body_html: Hi, Peter, Thanks. I’ve resolved the issues. The reason I’ve “access is denied” is due to McAfee Enterprise VirusScan/EPO access protection rules. One of the rules blocks the path to _C.cp36-win_amd64.pyd. Now the rule has been modified to allow Python pass through. What I do not understand is that Process Monitor seems giving the wrong information as I could see certain operations of _C.cp36-win_amd64.pyd were successful. However, I do not have any knowledge of _C.cp36-win_amd64 nor the details of the access protection rule to give a definite answer. All I could say in my case is that it’s nothing to do with file permission. If anyone has similar problems, try to disable Virsus scanners. If you could not do that as in my case, try to have a look at the virus scanners logs for any clues. Thanks for your help. Regards, Zhan From: peterjc123 [mailto:notifications@github.com] Sent: 18 August 2018 06:38 To: pytorch/pytorch <pytorch@noreply.github.com> Cc: Cui,Z,Zhan,TUS2 R <zhan.cui@bt.com>; Mention <mention@noreply.github.com> Subject: Re: [pytorch/pytorch] PyTorch ImportError (#9440) @ZCzhan<https://github.com/ZCzhan> Are you using the CPU version or the CUDA version? Could you show me the result of the loaded modules by running the following code? # pip install psutil first import psutil, os p = psutil.Process( os.getpid() ) old_dlls = set([dll.path for dll in p.memory_maps()]) import torch new_dlls = set([dll.path for dll in p.memory_maps()]) diff_dlls = new_dlls.difference(old_dlls) print('\n'.join(diff_dlls)) The result should be C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\numpy\core\umath.cp36-win_amd64.pyd C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\torch\lib\cudnn64_7.dll C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\torch\lib\cufft64_90.dll C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\torch\lib\cublas64_90.dll C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\numpy\core\multiarray_tests.cp36-win_amd64.pyd C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\numpy\linalg\_umath_linalg.cp36-win_amd64.pyd C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\torch\lib\shm.dll C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\numpy\random\mtrand.cp36-win_amd64.pyd C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\numpy\_mklinit.cp36-win_amd64.pyd C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\numpy\core\multiarray.cp36-win_amd64.pyd C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\torch\_C.cp36-win_amd64.pyd C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\torch\lib\cudart64_90.dll C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\torch\lib\nvToolsExt64_1.dll C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Library\bin\libiomp5md.dll C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\torch\_nvrtc.cp36-win_amd64.pyd C:\Windows\System32\msvcp140.dll C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\torch\lib\cusparse64_90.dll C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\torch\lib\ATen.dll C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Library\bin\mkl_rt.dll C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\mkl_fft\_pydfti.cp36-win_amd64.pyd C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\numpy\linalg\lapack_lite.cp36-win_amd64.pyd C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\numpy\fft\fftpack_lite.cp36-win_amd64.pyd Let's see what's missing body_text:
Hi, Peter,

Thanks.  I’ve resolved the issues.  The reason I’ve “access is denied” is due to McAfee Enterprise VirusScan/EPO access protection rules.  One of the rules blocks the path to _C.cp36-win_amd64.pyd.    Now the rule has been modified to allow Python pass through.

What I do not understand is that Process Monitor seems giving the wrong information as I could see certain operations of _C.cp36-win_amd64.pyd were successful.  However, I do not have any knowledge of _C.cp36-win_amd64 nor the details of the access protection rule to give a definite answer.  All I could say in my case is that it’s nothing to do with file permission.   If anyone has similar problems, try to disable Virsus scanners.  If you could not do that as in my case, try to have a look at the virus scanners logs for any clues.

Thanks for your help.

Regards,
Zhan

From: peterjc123 [mailto:notifications@github.com]
Sent: 18 August 2018 06:38
To: pytorch/pytorch <pytorch@noreply.github.com>
Cc: Cui,Z,Zhan,TUS2 R <zhan.cui@bt.com>; Mention <mention@noreply.github.com>
Subject: Re: [pytorch/pytorch] PyTorch ImportError (#9440)


@ZCzhan<https://github.com/ZCzhan> Are you using the CPU version or the CUDA version? Could you show me the result of the loaded modules by running the following code?

# pip install psutil first

import psutil, os

p = psutil.Process( os.getpid() )

old_dlls = set([dll.path for dll in p.memory_maps()])

import torch

new_dlls = set([dll.path for dll in p.memory_maps()])

diff_dlls = new_dlls.difference(old_dlls)

print('\n'.join(diff_dlls))

The result should be

C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\numpy\core\umath.cp36-win_amd64.pyd

C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\torch\lib\cudnn64_7.dll

C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\torch\lib\cufft64_90.dll

C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\torch\lib\cublas64_90.dll

C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\numpy\core\multiarray_tests.cp36-win_amd64.pyd

C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\numpy\linalg\_umath_linalg.cp36-win_amd64.pyd

C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\torch\lib\shm.dll

C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\numpy\random\mtrand.cp36-win_amd64.pyd

C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\numpy\_mklinit.cp36-win_amd64.pyd

C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\numpy\core\multiarray.cp36-win_amd64.pyd

C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\torch\_C.cp36-win_amd64.pyd

C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\torch\lib\cudart64_90.dll

C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\torch\lib\nvToolsExt64_1.dll

C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Library\bin\libiomp5md.dll

C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\torch\_nvrtc.cp36-win_amd64.pyd

C:\Windows\System32\msvcp140.dll

C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\torch\lib\cusparse64_90.dll

C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\torch\lib\ATen.dll

C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Library\bin\mkl_rt.dll

C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\mkl_fft\_pydfti.cp36-win_amd64.pyd

C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\numpy\linalg\lapack_lite.cp36-win_amd64.pyd

C:\Anaconda2\envs\test_new\Lib\site-packages\numpy\fft\fftpack_lite.cp36-win_amd64.pyd

Let's see what's missing there.

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

body:
Hi, Peter,

Thanks.  I’ve resolved the issues.  The reason I’ve “access is denied” is due to McAfee Enterprise VirusScan/EPO access protection rules.  One of the rules blocks the path to _C.cp36-win_amd64.pyd.    Now the rule has been modified to allow Python pass through.

What I do not understand is that Process Monitor seems giving the wrong information as I could see certain operations of _C.cp36-win_amd64.pyd were successful.  However, I do not have any knowledge of _C.cp36-win_amd64 nor the details of the access protection rule to give a definite answer.  All I could say in my case is that it’s nothing to do with file permission.   If anyone has similar problems, try to disable Virsus scanners.  If you could not do that as in my case, try to have a look at the virus scanners logs for any clues.

Thanks for your help.

Regards,
Zhan
